data.name: OQDescription
data.value: Looking back over the last week, help us understand how you have been feeling. Read each item carefully and mark the box which best describes your current situation.

data.name: PageDescriptionResponseComplete
data.value: Thank you for completing your questionnaires. Please click the "finish" button below to complete the process. Once you are done, please return the device to the front desk.

data.name: PageDescriptionSelectTest
data.value: Your counsellor or the front desk staff should have informed you what questionnaires you should complete before your counselling session today. If you are unsure, please contact the front desk for assistance.

data.name: SelectTestError
data.value: You must select at least one test

data.name: SRSDescription
data.value: Please rate today's session according to the following descriptions. Check the square that best describes your reaction using the following rating system.

data.name: SRSQuestion10Left
data.value: I felt hopeful after the session

data.name: SRSQuestion10Right
data.value: I felt hopeless after the session

data.name: SRSQuestion2Left
data.value: I felt my therapist was respectful

data.name: SRSQuestion2Right
data.value: The therapist pretended to respect or seemed not to respect me

data.name: SRSQuestion3Left
data.value: My therapist understood me and my feelings

data.name: SRSQuestion3Right
data.value: My therapist did not understand my feelings

data.name: SRSQuestion4Left
data.value: We worked on my goals; my goals were important

data.name: SRSQuestion4Right
data.value: My therapist was not sincere, was pretending

data.name: SRSQuestion5Left
data.value: My therapist was honest and sincere

data.name: SRSQuestion5Right
data.value: We worked on my therapist's goals; my goals didn't seem important

data.name: SRSQuestion6Left
data.value: I approve of the things we did in the session or what I was asked to do as a homework assignment

data.name: SRSQuestion6Right
data.value: I didn't like what we did in today's session or what I was asked to do as a homework assignment

data.name: SRSQuestion7Left
data.value: The treatment I received was right for me

data.name: SRSQuestion7Right
data.value: There was something wrong with the treatment I received

data.name: SRSQuestion8Left
data.value: My ideas about change were important and a focus of the session

data.name: UricaDescription
data.value: When answering the questions below, think about the problem you have come to the Centre to work through. Please indicate how much you disagree or agree with each of the following statements. Base your responses on how you are feeling and acting NOW.

data.name: YOQPDescription
data.value: The Y-OQ® 2.01 is designed to describe a wide range of troublesome situations, behaviors, and moods that are common in children and adolescents. You may discover that some of the items do not apply to your child’s current situation. If so, please do not leave these items blank but check the “Never or almost never” category. When you begin the Y-OQ® 2.01 you will see that you can easily make your child look as healthy or unhealthy as you wish. Please do not do that. If you are as accurate as possible it is more likely that you will be able to receive the help that you are seeking for your child.

data.name: YOQSRDescription
data.value: The Y-OQ® -SR 2.0 is designed to describe a wide range of troublesome situations, behaviors, and moods that are common in children and adolescents. You may discover that some of the items do not apply to your situation. If so, please do not leave these items blank but check the “Never or almost never” category. When you begin the Y-OQ® -SR 2.0 you will see that you can easily make yourself look as healthy or unhealthy as you wish. Please do not do that. If you are as accurate as possible it is more likely that you will be able to receive the help that you are seeking.

data.name: ACEDescription
data.value: When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life:

data.name: FAMDescription
data.value: In this section, you will find 42 statements about the relationship between yourself and another person. Read each statement carefully and decide how well the statement describes your relationship with this person. Make your response by choosing one of the provided answers ("SA", "A", "D", or "SD"). Choose only one response for each item. Mark an answer for every statement, even if you are not completely sure of your answer.

data.name: GCSDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the way you feel about your life and surroundings. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: ICSDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the way you feel about the amount of personal stress that you experience. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: NPAPSDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the non-physical abuse you have delivered upon your partner. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: PAPSDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the physical abuse you have delivered upon your partner. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: PASDescription
data.value:
Read each statement and decide whether it is an accurate statement about you.
  • If the statement is FALSE, NOT AT ALL TRUE, choose F.
  • If the statement is SLIGHTLY TRUE, choose ST.
  • If the statement is MAINLY TRUE, choose MT.
  • If the statement is VERY TRUE, choose VT.
Give your own opinion of yourself. Be sure to answer every statement.

data.name: PASNPDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the non-physical abuse you have experienced in your relationship with your partner. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: PASPHDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure the physical abuse you have experienced in your relationship with your partner. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: RSEDescription
data.value:
This scale is designed to measure self esteem. Answer each question by placing a number beside the item that best describes how much you agree or disagree with each one as follows:
  1. Strongly Agree
  2. Agree
  3. Disagree
  4. Strongly Disagree

data.name: RSFVPDescription
data.value:
If you are still in contact, please complete the rest of this booklet about your relationship with this person over the past 3 months.

If you are no longer in contact, please do not complete the rest of this booklet.

data.name: SDTDescription
data.value: Please select the answer that best applies to you.

data.name: TSCLDescription
data.value: The following are a list of issues that many people experience. How often have you experienced each of the following in the last TWO MONTHS?

data.name: UricaDVDescription
data.value:
This survey asks a lot of questions about violence. By "violence", we mean physical aggression toward a partner or ex-partner, like a wife or girlfriend. This includes throwing objects, pushing, slapping, kicking, or choking, using a weapon, and other behaviors that can cause fear, pain, or injury.

If you did none of these things, think about "violence" as the thing you did that got you arrested or got you into a domestic violence program.

By "ending the violence", we mean using healthy strategies to improve your relationship and stay violence-free. Examples of healthy strategies include:

  • Communicating with your partner clearly and respectfully.
  • Managing stress.
  • Controlling your anger.
  • Not abusing drugs or alcohol.

Please tell us how much you DISAGREE or AGREE with each of the following statements. Base your answers on how you're feeling and acting NOW.

data.name: SESDescription
data.value:
This questionnaire cites statements about your personal attitudes and traits. Read each statement and decide how it describes you. There are no right or wrong answers. Please be truthful and describe yourself as you really are, not as you would like to be.
  1. Disagree strongly
  2. Disagree moderately
  3. Neither agree nor disagree
  4. Agree moderately
  5. Agree strongly

data.name: ISEDescription
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to measure how you see yourself. It is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers. Please answer each item as carefully and as accurately as you can by checking the appropriate box.

data.name: CSQ8Description
data.value: Please assist us in improving our program by answering these questions. We are interested in your honest opinion, whether it is positive or negative. Please answer all of the questions. We also welcome your comments and suggestions. Thank you very much, we really appreciate your help.

data.name: CSQ8QuestionnaireTitle
data.value: The Calgary Counselling Centre Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ-8)

data.name: EDI3Description2
data.value: For each item, decide if the item is true about you ALWAYS, USUALLY, OFTEN, SOMETIMES, RARELY, or NEVER. Choose the letter that appears beneath your answer for each question. Respond to ALL of the items, making sure that you choose the option that is true about you.

data.name: CDI2Description
data.value:
Kids sometimes have different feelings and ideas.

This form lists the feelings and ideas in groups. From each group of three sentences, pick one sentence that describes you best for the past two weeks. After you pick a sentence from the first group, go on to the next group.

There is no right or wrong answer. Just pick a sentence that best describes the way you have been recently. Put a mark in the box next to the sentence that you pick.

Remember, for each group, pick out the sentence that describes you best in the PAST TWO WEEKS.

data.name: DAIRDescription
data.value: In this section, you will find 42 statements about the situation in your family before and after your separation. Read each statement carefully and decide how much you agree or disagree with the statement. Make your response by choosing one of the provided answers ("SA", "A", "N", "D", or "SD"). Choose only one response for each item. Mark an answer for every statement, even if you are not completely sure of your answer.

data.name: PSIDescription
data.value:
This questionnaire contains 36 statements. Read each statement carefully. For each statement, please focus on the child you are most concerned about and choose the response that best represents your opinion. Answer all questions about the same child.

  • Choose SD if you strongly disagree with the statement.
  • Choose D if you disagree with the statement.
  • Choose NS if you are not sure how you feel about the statement.
  • Choose A if you agree with the statement.
  • Choose SA if you strongly agree with the statement.

While you may not find a response that exactly states your feelings, please choose the response that comes closest to describing how you feel. Your first reaction to each question should be your answer. Choose only one response for each statement and respond to each statemenr.

data.name: SIPADescription
data.value:
This questionnaire contains 112 statements. Read each statement carefully. Please focus on the adolescent you are currently concerned about, and choose the response which best represents your opinion.

For statements 1-90:

  • Choose SD if you strongly disagree with the statement.
  • Choose D if you disagree with the statement.
  • Choose NS if you are not sure how you feel about the statement.
  • Choose A if you agree with the statement.
  • Choose SA if you strongly agree with the statement.

For statements 91-112:

  • Choose Y for "Yes".
  • Choose N for "No".

Although you may not find a response that exactly states your feelings, please choose the response that comes closest to describing how you feel.YOUR FIRST REACTION TO EACH QUESTION SHOULD BE YOUR ANSWER.

Questions about your "spouse or partner" refer to your husband or wife, or other parenting partner (i.e., the other person who is most involved in the parenting of your child). If you do not currently have a spouse or partner, leave these items blank.

data.name: Tbl_GoodPartOfTheTime
data.value: A Good Part of the Time
